Panzerschreck was the popular name for the Raketenpanzerbchse (
abbreviated to RPzB), an 88 mm calibre reusable anti-tank rocket launcher 
developed by Nazi Germany in World War II. Another popular nickname was 
Ofenrohr ("stove pipe"). The Panzerschreck was designed as a lightweight 
infantry anti-tank weapon. ... The American bazookas also spurred the 
development of the Faustpatrone...
